page.title: 04Chislehurst & Sidcup G.S.
page.content: Chis & Sid is located at Hurst road in Sidcup.{Built in 1954-55,}a boys school until 1972 when it merged with Chislehurst School for girls. There are over 70 teachers, 1200 pupils and 60 classrooms and labs.The headmaster is{Mr.J.M.Sennett.}A new building, called The New Block, was built in the 1960's, with toilets, a medical room and about 12 classrooms. A{large range of subjects}are taught, including computing and specialised crafts. It is a traditional Rugby School, but a{wide range of}other {sports}are taught: cricket, athletics, tennis, netball etc. A large range of{clubs}are run at lunch times and after school: film society, photographic club etc. Holidays abroad are run as well as {educational day trips,}as an integral part of the schools' curriculum.
